entry.title: Upgrading out-of-date OpenBSD installs
entry.content: First of all, don't do how I do. Upgrade your installs regularly. OpenBSD makes it very easy.

entry.title: geocheatcode
entry.content: Here is background and code for a trick I use to get Google to give me best-in-class guesses for latitude and longitude, despite goofy and/or downright bad location searches.

entry.title: intake
entry.content: candidal esophagitis, achalasia, H Pylori PUD

entry.title: Set Up Enterprise Wifi on Arch Linux
entry.content: Most big institutions have guest and employee wifi networks. Guest wifi is usually fine, fast enough for the basics, but far inferior to employee wifi. On a custom-built OS, such as a fairly minimalist Linux distribution, getting the employee wifi to work can be a beast.
